results.title: Why China’s Shrinking Population Is Cause for Alarm
results.abstract: China struggled for years to curtail its rapid population growth. Now that its population is declining, economists and others fear serious implications for China and countries around the world.

media.caption: A family cradling their child at a park in Beijing. Data released this week by the Chinese government revealed that the country’s population has begun to shrink.
media.copyright: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

results.title: A Shrinking, Aging China May Have Backed Itself Into a Corner
results.abstract: A demographics challenge has been building for years, but Beijing’s preparations are lagging. Now, many worry that current measures may offer too little, too late.

media.caption: Babies hold Chinese flags during a holiday celebration in Beijing in 2019. A declining birthrate and aging population have thrust China into a demographic bind.
